PreparerFirmName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: C DeWitt Foard & Co PA CPAs

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To advance public understanding and respect for the rule of law and the role of the legal profession; to promote the highest ideals of professionalism, public service and access to the legal system; and to support the charitable and educational goals of the Mecklenburg County Bar.
IRS990.MissionDesc: To advance public understanding and respect for the rule of law and the role of the legal profession; to promote the highest ideals of professionalism, public service and access to the legal system; and to support the charitable and educational goals of the Mecklenburg County Bar.
IRS990.Desc: The Foundation has established a Bar Center which provides services to the general public, attorneys, and other non-profit organizations which provide free legal assistance. The mission of the Foundation is to advance public understanding and respect for the rule of law and the role of the legal profession; to promote the highest ideals of the profession, public service, and access to the legal system; and to support the charitable and educational goals of the Mecklenburg County Bar.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XI, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THE GRANTS IN PART II - PURPOSETo support its Bar Leadership Institute Grant ($5,750): To cultivate leaders with an emphasis on giving back to the Bar and the community through involvement with the MCB and MBF leadership projects.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: End of year report providing details of how grant funds were used.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 2: Description of Business or Family Relationship of Officers, Directors, Et
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Three members of the board are partners at the same law firm. Two members of the board are partners at the same law firm.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11b: Form 990 Review Process
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Director, Director of Finance and HR, and a member of the Executive Committee review and approve the 990 before it is filed. A copy of the Form 990 is provided to every board member before it is filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The conflict of interest policy is provided to each director and each director is required to annually certify compliance and prospectively disclose potential conflicts of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Made available on Mecklenburg County Bar's website.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Mecklenburg County Bar Exempt Code Section
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Mecklenburg County Bar is exempt from Federal income tax as an integral part of a political subdivision of the state of North Carolina.
